posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked:
The Signal team is releasing the Signal 7.58 beta soon.

If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here.

Using Obtanium? Remember to opt-in for pre-release tags to receive beta updates.

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

Complete list of new commits since 7.57.2:
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.57.2…main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.57 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.58.0 (159200)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

35 new commits since 7.57.2:

Show commits

  • Convert GroupId to Kotlin. [1]

  • Remove unnecessary SMS entrypoint. [2]

    Fixes #14213

  • Catch ZK validation error in profile fetch. [3]

  • Convert RecipientId to Kotlin. [4]

  • Remove ParcelableGroupId. [5]

  • Add new navigation and pane support. [6]

  • Add remote config support for large screen UI. [7]

  • Fix anchor offset when search or action mode is entered. [8]

  • Add lint detection for System.out.println add kotlin.io.println usage. [9]

  • Don't exit multiselect mode when swapping screens. [10]

  • Bump to libsignal v0.81.1. [11]

  • Update username link logo. [12]

    Resolves #14258

  • Increase desired width increment to aleviate situations where certain text would still flow to multiple lines. [13]

  • Update BackupMediaSnapshot to be based on attachments in backup frames. [14]

  • Improve free tier UX around media. [15]

  • Move large screen check to wrapper. [16]

  • Fix backups UI scaling issues. [17]

  • Remove regv2. [18]

  • Move v3 classes to base registration package. [19]

  • Remove hard coded message backups remote config. [20]

  • Fix de related crash and bug. [21]

  • Fix RTL ByteSize rendering. [22]

  • Fix padding on button when we have a current tier. [23]

  • Utilize keepLonger throughout BillingApiImpl. [24]

  • Add checks to skip check job if we have a pending or pre-pending transaction. [25]

  • Add new log sections to backups. [26]

  • Remove separate controllers and consolidate logic. [27]

  • Do not display a price if it's been zeroed. [28]

  • Remove transitions from base NavHost. [29]

  • Ignore mismatch state if FREE tier user has GPB sub. [30]

  • Ignore PNI messages for everything except server delivery receipts. [31]

  • Prevent IMO from running before registration. [32]

  • Clear credentials in pre-restore state. [33]

  • Update translations and other static files. [34]

  • Bump version to 7.58.0 [35]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.57.2…v7.58.0

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

link_counts.title: Get the latest Android releases even faster with Firebase App Distribution

posts.cooked:
Salt505:

Complete list of new commits since 7.57.0:

Should be since v7.57.2

posts.name: ClauZ
posts.cooked:
7.58.0 Long time network failure error when trying to enable remote backups

I still get this network failure issue, when I try to enable the remote backups on one of my RO phone numbers, that was reg locked for a bit

screenshot

image482×1036 65 KB

I doubt it’s an actual network error, and I would like a more descriptive error message please, for whatever the issue is.

log: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.58.0/e2462447387d18bf72fef4496f50edb2508d7cde52aecbc223a2fd58bd821cd0

Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.79 release

Backups is a cross-platform feature, and you should be able to restore your Backups on either a TestFlight iOS build, or an Android beta build. However, please note that using paid-tier Backups on Android will require a purchase.

It’s probably this what you are experiencing?

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.79 release

posts.cooked: Ah that seems to be it guess I’ll just wait it out then rip at least I was able to back everything up without any issues so yay

posts.name: Jeffrey
posts.cooked:
I sent a pdf file to my partner. It change to unnamed file name. It don’t keep the original file name.

Screenshot

IMG_20250925_1829161216×740 55 KB

Debug Log

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.58.0/bd1c879fcf875713b84af97ec99a7878c620ec326702e50664f3817a82dcc74c

chiwaijm:

I sent a pdf file to my partner. It change to unnamed file name. It don’t keep the original file name.

Looks like it happens for me too tracking!

link_counts.title: Naming of file attachments has changed

posts.cooked:
Tried to restore a TestFlight backup onto the android beta and it doesn’t seem to work. I’m not too sure if the log will have anything useful cause I could only get it after force closing the app so please let me know if you need another log. The only thing I can think of is maybe I don’t have enough storage space but what confused me about that is when restoring the backup it says 20mb when the actually backup is around 20gb

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.58.0/e54cd669df6aaf0cd2469c0ba46f6ab9f6de803f1267d06252631fd9111c373f

posts.name: ClauZ
posts.cooked:
7.58.0 Cross platform restore iOS → Android

So I had someone register an account on iOS, enable remote backups free tier, and then send a message and an image in note to self.

Then I restored that account on my Android,
and that Image from note to self has some glitches when I open it, and when I exit the conversation.

Also, if I send new images to note to self, they flicker when I enter the conversation

Android log: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.58.0/3ea980411b5c153c6cd48b1603c50c0acb39dca6b823b88b27a9b950d26fcb88

Glitch: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AoIVR1gqb7w

flicker: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bYNPW1pdSzY

7.58.0 Phone number lock out from iOS

so, I am testing cross platform backup restore, and someone locked a phone number on an iOS device, by requesting to many SMS codes

Screenshot

image1920×1080 265 KB

Then I tried to register with the same phone number on Android, and It told me that it will send an SMS code, and now it’s stuck loading… at the phone number screen

GIF Rec

log: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.58.0/413649bac0eb15c9316c8ca30055a7faef1785a0eccb2e58757a145bc48155c6

Continuing the discussion from Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.57 release:

Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.57 release

7.57.0 Crash on username search

This still happens, in 7.58.0

log: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.58.0/eb5bd8c6fd8102ba23ed8e44fd1051bbfaefd5fc04ae0e6b553e2b5a82a4fec3

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.58.0/5eb5258c829f6970771d915d27ee061f23afea0772abf1d7628a531118bb4630

And the renewal state.

Very long send for a message containing media, about 10 seconds.

My Android log: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.58.0/dcee45d4f460087f3db2228658348ae01b572625030dff58b5a98304e796f411

Recipient Desktop log: https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.72.1/5f9d9965818ee8c7faea70e44079ed8904f28908f3e96b75f60503f77e8447e6.gz

Edit: force stop didn’t resolve.

Edit 2: new Android log after messages went through. They hung in sending for almost 30 minutes.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.58.0/5de168e2664e47a7d1bed07b5d5e0379377b70101538455c851a02864533e4e1

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
jeffrey-signal:

Could you provide some more details about the issues you’re encountering? I’m not quite following

I get this message for renewal

10000359141344×2992 140 KB

And clicking on view settings here does nothing:

10000359151344×2992 129 KB

I turned on airplane mode and Signal instantly started to ‘checking for messages’.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.58.0/25a745234059f3aa9063b69e7c0a91c2ca3f48e8fc3567ee4c1c4d58d0beb48e

New Version: 7.58.1 (159300)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

4 new commits since 7.58.0:

  • Fix upload to archive running while not on wifi. [1]

  • Fix header case bugs in status code errors. [2]

  • Update translations and other static files. [3]

  • Bump version to 7.58.1 [4]

posts.cooked:
Tried to restore my backup on 7.58.1 and unfortunately still run into the same issues as before

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.58.1/c60db63200ae529f29ce6a498941dff19be989119ab2d0e511a57640a72e2ba9

My default disappearing message timer did not activate upon receiving the first message from a new contact that used my username to initiate.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.58.1/04fc16847b71ccb26b010e9f0cfeca8ec8c561a1795bd13df5cea27d67d899fe

posts.name: Michelle
posts.cooked:
Avitus:

My default disappearing message timer did not activate

Will double check but I believe that the automatic one only kicks in if you initiate the chat.

Gunter:

Tried to restore my backup on 7.58.1 and unfortunately still run into the same issues as before

Tracking!
